name: Resolution_20-688.pdf
text:
COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA
D.C. Resolution 20-688, effective November 18, 2014

20 DCSTAT 4616

A RESOLUTION

Proposed
Resolution
20-1133

To declare the existence of an emergency with respect to the need to exclude the standard deduction from
withholding calculations for an employer.

See Emergency
D.C. Act 20-510
20 DCStat 4434

RESOLVED, BY THE COUNCIL OF THE DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA, That this
resolution may be cited as the “Standard Deduction Withholding Clarification Emergency
Declaration Resolution of 2014”.

Standard
Deduction
Withholding
Clarification
Emergency
Declaration
Resolution of
2014

Sec. 2. (a) The Fiscal Year 2012 Budget Support Technical Clarification Temporary
Amendment Act of 2011, effective October 11, 2011 (D.C. Law 19-53; 58 DCR 8954),
amended section 47-1812.08 of the District of Columbia Official Code to exclude the standard
deduction from withholding calculations for employers.
(b) There is an urgent need to reestablish this exclusion. Not acting expeditiously will
result in a substantial one-time revenue loss for Fiscal Year 2015 and ongoing losses in lesser
amounts in subsequent years.
Sec. 3. The Council of the District of Columbia determines that the circumstances
enumerated in section 2 constitute emergency circumstances making it necessary that the
Standard Deduction Withholding Clarification Emergency Amendment Act of 2014 be adopted
after a single reading.
Sec. 4. This resolution shall take effect immediately.
title: Standard Deduction Withholding Clarification Emergency Declaration Resolution of 2014
